"The Singer Group has developed into one of the US's most successful

Rick Singer told parents that he could facilitate their children's admission

This is America. Like, you got money?
Best believe you have access to certain spaces that other kids don't have.
translation.ko: 그럼 다른 애들은 꿈도 못 꾸는 곳에 갈 수 있죠

translation.en: So I'm… I'm really not surprised…
[Jon Reider] Over the last three or four decades,
higher education has become increasingly a commodity.
translation.ko: 고등교육은 점점 상품화됐죠 "존 리더 스탠퍼드대 입학사정관 역임"

translation.en: Something that you purchase. A product.
translation.ko: "존 리더 스탠퍼드대 입학사정관 역임" 돈을 주고 사는 제품이 됐어요

translation.en: It's a goal in and of itself, rather than the goal being to get an education.
translation.ko: 교육받는 게 목표라기보다는 그 자체가 목표가 됐죠

translation.en: It's become a status point.
Your status has now increased
translation.ko: "바버라 칼머스 개인 교육 컨설턴트" 자녀가 엘리트 교육기관에 다니면 자신의 지위도 덩달아 높아져요

translation.en: because your child is at what's called an "elite institution."
translation.ko: 자녀가 엘리트 교육기관에 다니면 자신의 지위도 덩달아 높아져요

translation.en: It's all about bragging rights.
The running line in our industry is like, "The parents are applying to college."
translation.ko: 우리 업계의 통념이 이렇습니다 '대학에 지원하는 건 부모고' "페리 칼머스 개인 교육 컨설턴트"

translation.en: "The kid is the vehicle through which they apply to college."
If you're a freshman, I'm sorry,
because you are gonna be thrown into a world where they're gonna be like,
translation.ko: 너희는 이제 이런 세상에 내동댕이쳐질 테니까

translation.en: "College, college, college."
"Go to college. You have to get the best grades."
"If you're not, you're gonna feel like a failure. You're the worst."
If you're a parent and you didn't go to Harvard,
this is your chance to now go to Harvard, right? In your warped mind.
translation.ko: 이건 한을 풀 기회죠 뒤틀린 생각이긴 하지만요

translation.en: [Bello] It's typically accepted that Ivy League institutions

But all of those differences have almost nothing to do
translation.ko: 그런데 그 차이점은 학교의 학술적 성과와는

translation.en: with the academics of the institution.
U.S. News started ranking colleges in the '80s,
translation.ko: 'US 뉴스'가 대학 순위를 매기기 시작한 게 80년대인데

translation.en: based on one criteria: prestige.
That's it. [chuckles] That's it.
"Prestige" is actually a French word.
In the original French, it means something people don't realize.
translation.ko: 원래 프랑스어로, '사람들이 깨닫지 못하는 것'이란 뜻이죠

translation.en: It means "deceit."
That's what prestige is in the college.
It's imaginary. It's an illusion. Yet people believe in it.
translation.ko: 모두 상상이죠, 환상이에요 그런데도 사람들은 그걸 믿죠

translation.en: It's not just population growth that makes it harder to get into colleges today.
translation.ko: 오늘날 인구가 많아져서 입학이 어려워진 게 아녜요

translation.en: The colleges themselves have brought it about.

translation.ko: 서류상 좀 더 까다로워 보여야 학교 순위가 올라가거든요

translation.en: Everything these schools are doing is massaging to try and up the rankings.

translation.en: And it's a really dangerous game.
[Golden] Most people see college admissions,

translation.ko: 인종 할당제를 제외하고는 성적에 따라 결정된다고 생각하죠

translation.en: My view of the admissions process is all sorts of different preferences,

translation.en: with, yes, some students getting in on pure merit,
translation.ko: 네, 물론 순전히 성적이 좋아 합격하기도 합니다

translation.en: but many others getting in due to preferences that skew rich and white.
translation.ko: 하지만 부자이고 백인이기 때문에 합격하는 경우도 많아요

translation.en: One is by preferences for students who play niche sports,

translation.en: Then there's making a huge donation to a university.
translation.ko: 그리고 또 대학에 거액을 기부하는 것도 있습니다

translation.en: That gets them noticed by the fundraising office,

Jared Kushner was the son of a very wealthy real estate developer

translation.en: if you want to absolutely guarantee your kid's gonna get in.

-Bill McGlashan, good to see you. -Nice to be here.

He was 145 pounds. Long snapper.
[chuckles] So what I'll probably need is,

He wants it that way.
[Singer] Your guy Agustin?
[McGlashan] Agustin Huneeus, yeah.

translation.ko: 릭한테 얘기하라고 했죠 릭과 상의하라고 했어요

translation.en: No, that's good. He's pushing hard. Like, "You gotta tell me what they're doing."

Well, he tried that. He tried that.

translation.en: about the side door approach you have and was sort of suggesting,

translation.en: Agreed. Agreed. Yeah. And that's…
And that's what worries me, too.
I said, "Listen, you are in a very competitive environment."
translation.ko: 그래서 말했죠, '잘 들어요 지금 경쟁이 심한 환경에 계세요'

translation.en: "You have to keep what you do to yourself. It will blow up on you.

translation.en: No matter who you think you know, it doesn't matter."
That's right, and he's not discreet at all.

translation.ko: 그래서 이 얘기를 그자에게 하는 게 편치 않더라고요

translation.en: -Good. -Right.
Rick Singer provided reassurance.
The reassurance that other people just like you
translation.ko: "나오미 프라이 '더 뉴요커' 전속 기자" '다른 사람들도 아버님처럼 하니까 안심하셔도 좋습니다'

translation.en: are going through this thing.
"I've dealt with this a million times."
Rick was like a therapist or a life coach,

[Justin Paperny] My profile of Rick Singer is he's a born salesman.
translation.ko: 제가 볼 때 릭 싱어는 타고난 세일즈맨이에요

translation.en: He was smooth and subtle,

translation.ko: 고압적이지 않고 시간이 있단 걸 알았어요 "저스틴 페이퍼니 연방 교도소 컨설턴트"

So what sport would be the best for them?
Is… is crew the best? Is that even gonna really matter?

I'll make him a sailor or something because of where you live.

translation.en: [reporter] Massachusetts businessman John Wilson.

He's accused of paying more than a million dollars

translation.ko: 100만 달러 이상을 지급한 혐의를 받고 있습니다

Okay. I'll send you the information about the bank and the wiring stuff
translation.ko: 그럼 내일쯤 은행과 송금에 관한 정보를

All right.
Oh, by the way, mark your calendar for next July

-I rented out Versailles. -[chuckles] Oh, my God!

translation.en: One of the amazing things about Rick Singer is that this guy,
translation.ko: 릭 싱어도 평범한 사람은 아니라는 생각이 듭니다

translation.en: from a kind of obscure background and without a lot to show on paper,

and made an awful lot of money doing it.

translation.en: My sense was that Rick Singer had a somewhat unhappy childhood.
translation.ko: 제 느낌이지만 다소 불행한 어린 시절을 보낸 것 같아요

translation.en: His parents divorced when he was young.
He was bright. He had the gift of the gab unquestionably.
After childhood, he went to several colleges.
translation.ko: 고등학교를 졸업한 후엔 여러 대학에서 공부했고

translation.en: After that, he went into coaching.
But his problem was he was too volatile, particularly as a high school coach.
translation.ko: 그런데 릭은 다혈질이어서 특히 고등학교 코치엔 안 맞았어요

translation.en: He tended to scream at the players if something went wrong.
translation.ko: 경기가 안 풀리면 선수들한테 소리치기 일쑤였거든요

translation.en: Kind of like the Bobby Knight of high school coaching.
When Sacramento State had a bad year, they went 4 and 24 one year,
the whole coaching staff was fired, and that included Singer.
translation.ko: 코치진 전체가 해고됐는데 그중에 싱어도 있었죠

translation.en: That's when he looked around and he said,
"Maybe basketball coaching isn't for me after all.
translation.ko: 농구 코치는 자신과 안 맞다고 생각했을 겁니다

translation.en: I've gotta switch careers."
And he noticed this new industry of independent college advisors,
translation.ko: 그때 개인 입시 컨설턴트라는 새로운 분야를 알게 됐고

translation.en: and he became the first one in Sacramento.
translation.ko: 새크라멘토에서 최초로 그 일을 한 사람이 됐죠

translation.en: It's interesting how his background, in a way, prepared him for this scandal.
translation.ko: 릭이 이 스캔들을 일으킨 건 어떻게 보면 배경 때문이에요

translation.en: If you think about it, as a basketball coach in college,
he had firsthand exposure to how athletic admissions worked,
translation.ko: 어떡해야 체육 특기생이 되는지 직접 목격했거든요

translation.ko: 체육 특기생에 관해 속속들이 알고 있었으니까요

translation.ko: - 저기요, 존, 어떻게 지내요? - 반가워요, 릭, 잘 지내요 "2018년 10월 27일"

translation.en: I'm here in a big rainstorm in Saudi Arabia.
-[Singer] Saudi Arabia? -[Wilson] Yeah, I'm in Dubai.

[Wilson] Yeah, I know. Very unusual. What's happening?

translation.ko: 도나가 제게 알려줄 겁니다 그럼 만사형통이죠

translation.en: Essentially, she's been admitted before she even applied.
translation.ko: 기본적으로 지원하기도 전에 입학 허가를 받은 셈이에요

translation.en: At that point, you will send your $200,000 check to our foundation.
translation.ko: 그럼 그때 20만 달러를 우리 재단에 보내시면 되죠

translation.en: Then Jovan will call me and say, "Okay, this is how I want the money split."
translation.ko: 그 돈을 어떻게 분배할지는 요반이 제게 알려줄 거예요 "'요반'이 누구지?"

translation.en: You understand my daughter's not worthy to be on that team.
translation.ko: 우리 딸은 그 팀에 들어갈 실력이 안 된다는 거 알잖아요

translation.en: No, no, he's my guy,
translation.ko: 아뇨, 아뇨 그 사람은 우리 팀이에요

translation.en: and he knows she's not coming to play. He knows all that.
translation.ko: 따님이 연습장에 안 올 걸 알죠 다 알고 있어요

translation.en: There were four USC employees that were involved with Rick Singer.
translation.ko: "요반 바비츠 올해의 국대 코치" 릭 싱어 사건에 연루된 남가주대 직원이 4명인데

translation.en: One of them was Jovan Vavic, the water polo coach.
translation.ko: 그중 하나인 요반 바비츠는 수구 코치예요

translation.en: Vavic is by far the most successful coach in college water polo.
translation.ko: 바비츠는 대학 수구에서 단연코 가장 성공한 코치죠

translation.en: Vavic has been charged by authorities of accepting more than $250,000
translation.ko: 바비츠는 25만 달러 이상을 받고 학생 2명을 수구 선수로 위장해

translation.en: in exchange for helping two students get into USC as water polo players.
translation.ko: 남가주대에 입학시킨 혐의로 당국에 의해 기소됐습니다

translation.en: [Singer] Donna Heinel essentially puts them on the recruited walk-on list,
translation.ko: 도나가 따님을 스카우트 없이 선발된 선수로 분류할 거예요

translation.en: which happens all the time.
And they just don't show up for practice, and that's fine.
translation.ko: 그럼 연습장에 안 나타나도 문제 될 게 없죠

translation.en: One of the things Singer took advantage of
was the fact that athletic departments and admissions offices
translation.ko: 운동선수를 선정할 때 지원자의 운동 능력에 관한 한

translation.en: both take a coach's word
for the athletic caliber of the person they're recruiting.
Is there any risk that this thing blows up in my face?
translation.ko: 내 면전에서 일이 터질 위험이 없겠어요?

translation.en: [Singer] It hasn't in 24 years.
No, I know all that, but the environment…
Like, some article comes out
that the polo team is selling seats into the school for 250 grand.
translation.ko: 25만 달러에 판다는 기사가 나올 수 있잖아요

translation.en: Well, no, because she's a water polo player.
translation.ko: 그런 일은 없어요 따님은 수구 선수거든요

translation.en: But she's not.
[Chloe] I'm so scared.
[woman] Check it. No matter what happens, you're gonna be fine.
translation.ko: 확인해봐, 결과가 어떻든 넌 괜찮을 테니까

translation.en: -[man] You have to face it. -[woman] You have to face it. Yeah.
translation.ko: - 현실을 직시해야 해 - 현실을 직시해야 해, 그래

translation.en: -You're gonna be fine. I promise. -I got deferred.
translation.ko: - 넌 괜찮을 거야, 내 말 믿어 - 나 대기자래

translation.en: [woman] You got deferred?
There's an update in your application portal,
you click on it, and then that letter pops up.
"We appreciate your passion for our school. We're sorry to inform you…"
translation.ko: '우리 학교에 대한 귀하의 열정에 감사합니다, 유감스럽게도…'

translation.en: "…we are unable to offer you admission to Stanford."
I'm not getting into San Diego or UCLA.
Just makes me feel like shit.
I literally started bawling. Like, it just angered me.
translation.ko: 말 그대로 엉엉 울었어요 화가 치밀어 올랐죠

translation.en: There were a lot of tears, punching the wall, cursing.
translation.ko: 엄청나게 울었어요 주먹으로 벽을 치고, 욕하고…

translation.en: I didn't leave my room. I was crying the entire weekend.
translation.ko: 방 밖으로 나가지도 않고 주말 내내 울었어요

translation.en: I got rejected.
[Priscilla Sands] I have seen a change, and I have seen a progression.
And I do think that students are more obsessed with college.
translation.ko: 학생들이 갈수록 대학에 더 집착하는 것 같아요 "프리실라 샌즈 말버러 학교 교장"

translation.en: I'd say most kids are getting plagued by this anxiety, and you can feel it.
translation.ko: 아이들 대부분이 이런 걱정으로 괴로워하는 게 느껴져요

translation.en: They're freaking out when you meet with them.
translation.ko: 직접 만나 보세요, 겁에 질려 있죠

translation.en: They're like, "What if this happens?" "What about that?"
"Will they not like me because I wrote this one word?"
translation.ko: '내가 쓴 그 한 단어 때문에 날 싫어하지 않을까?'

translation.en: It's like they're losing their minds because of it.
Basically, I got rejected by almost all of the colleges I applied to.
translation.ko: 여러 대학에 지원했는데 거의 다 불합격되고 나니

translation.en: It's awful because you think something's wrong with yourself.
translation.ko: 저한테 문제가 있나 싶어 기분이 너무 안 좋아요

translation.en: When we have children and they apply to colleges, where will they go?
translation.ko: 우리 아이들이 대학에 갈 때쯤엔 어느 대학에 가죠?

translation.en: No one's getting into colleges at that point.
It's crazy. Like, USC's acceptance rate just went down three more percent.
translation.ko: 장난 아녜요, 남가주대 합격률이 3%나 더 떨어져서

translation.en: It's at 12% now, which is like…
Most students who wanna go to college could find a college.
translation.ko: 갈 수 있는 대학이 없는 건 아녜요

translation.en: The problem is
far too many students want to go to the same colleges.
translation.ko: 많은 학생이 같은 대학만 원한다는 거죠

translation.en: My goals were Ivy League. I wanted to get in that.
And when I didn't get in, I was… just broken.
I took AP bio. I'm taking AP environmental science this year. I…
translation.ko: AP 생물을 수강했고 올해 AP 환경 과학도 들을 거예요

translation.en: I'm not interested in it at all.
Just to have this extra leverage that doesn't even help.
translation.ko: 입시에 도움 되라고요 근데 그렇지도 않네요

translation.en: [Barbara Kalmus] This is going on in high schools across the country.
translation.ko: 전국의 고등학교에서 이런 일이 벌어지고 있어요

translation.en: How many advanced classes can you take?
translation.ko: AP 수업을 몇 개 들을 수 있죠?

translation.en: You drop orchestra because if you don't do orchestra, you can take another science class.
translation.ko: 오케스트라를 그만둡니다 그러곤 과학을 하나 더 들어요

translation.en: There's so much pressure on these kids.
translation.ko: 아이들이 느끼는 압박감은 이루 말할 수 없죠

translation.en: Because if a school offers 15 APs and you've only taken one,
translation.ko: 학교에 AP 과목이 15개인데 그중 하나만 들으면

translation.en: you can cross off the top 50 schools in the country.
You have people who just go home and all they do is homework.
translation.ko: 학교 끝나면 집에 가서 숙제만 하는 애들이 있어요

translation.en: I hate seeing how it consumes people's lives.
translation.ko: 인생이 그렇게 소비되는 게 너무 싫어요

translation.en: I think social media is a contributing factor,
because as soon as a student anywhere has an acceptance, it goes onto social media,
translation.ko: 어느 학교에든 합격하면 학생들이 소셜 미디어에 올리죠

translation.en: so it's just another time to sort of feel a punch in the gut.
translation.ko: 그건 불난 집에 부채질하는 것과 같아요

translation.en: It's just really shitty to feel like this.
And I know that people that got in are super deserving.
translation.ko: 다들 합격할 만하니까 합격했다는 건 알지만요

translation.en: I like to curl my fake lash with my real lashes.
translation.ko: 저는 속눈썹 뷰러를 쓸 때 진짜랑 가짜를 같이 올려요

translation.en: [Fry] Olivia Jade is an extremely successful YouTube influencer.
translation.ko: 올리비아 제이드는 크게 성공한 유튜브 인플루언서죠

translation.en: She had millions of followers watch these videos where she would,
translation.ko: 팔로워 수백만 명이 올리비아의 비디오를 봅니다

translation.en: you know, get up, brush her teeth, do her morning makeup routine,
translation.ko: 아침에 일어나서 이 닦고 아침 루틴 화장하고

translation.en: pick out outfits. So it's this very diary-like thing,
translation.ko: 옷을 고르는 모습을요 일종의 일기 같은 거죠

translation.en: but with the added benefit of branding opportunities.
I created my own collection with Princess Polly.
I get to reveal and announce
my highlight palette with Sephora Collection.
[Fry] She's the child of the actress Lori Loughlin
and the fashion designer Mossimo Giannulli.
They supposedly had both of their daughters, Olivia Jade and Bella,
translation.ko: 두 사람은 두 딸인 올리비아와 벨라를

translation.en: pose on a rowing machine, and sent these pictures to Rick Singer
translation.ko: 로잉 머신에 앉혀 사진을 찍고 그걸 릭 싱어에게 보내

translation.en: and had them accepted into USC as coxswains.
I went to high school with Olivia Jade. I know the school she was at.
translation.ko: 올리비아랑 고등학교 동창이라서 걔가 어느 대학에 갔는지 알아요

translation.en: I saw a picture of Olivia Jade's sister on the wall with the seniors,
translation.ko: 학교 벽에 올리비아 언니가 동기들과 찍은 사진이 있었는데

translation.en: and it was like, "Congratulations for getting into USC."
And then I remember hearing later that Olivia had also gotten into USC.
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 나중에 올리비아도 남가주대에 간다고 하더라고요

translation.en: I was like, "Whoa." 'Cause USC is extremely hard to get into.
translation.ko: 너무 놀랐죠, 들어가기가 정말 어려운 학교거든요

translation.en: So not only one sister, but both of them.
translation.ko: 근데 하나도 아니고 둘 다 합격했잖아요

translation.en: Off to school. [Loughlin] Bye, Olivia. Have a lovely day.
translation.ko: - 학교 다녀올게요 - 그래, 좋은 하루 되렴

translation.en: -I know you're so excited. -I won't. I will not.
translation.ko: - 네가 얼마나 신났는지 알아 - 안 그래요, 아녜요

translation.en: Whatever.
[Naomi Fry] There's an Olivia Jade video
where it's the first day of her senior year of high school,
translation.ko: 고등학교 졸업반 첫날을 기록한 게 있는데

translation.en: and she's pretty miserable.
I've gone to one class, and I wanna die.
It's so hot in every single room.
I just wanna go home.
Then she returns home and she says, "I've never been so happy."
translation.ko: 그러고 집에 와서는 그렇게 행복해할 수가 없어요

translation.en: I've never been so happy to be anywhere in my whole entire life.
Then there's also a nod to a kind of, like, you know, #blessed.
Remember how lucky we are to have an education
translation.ko: 교육받을 수 있는 걸 행운으로 여겨야 해요

translation.en: and how many people would kill to have a good education.
translation.ko: 좋은 교육을 위해서라면 목숨 내놓을 사람도 많거든요

translation.en: Or an education at all. So, as much as I hate it…
translation.ko: 어떤 교육이든 간에요 그래서 학교 가기 싫지만…

translation.en: I still hate it, but I'm grateful that I get to be educated.
translation.ko: 지금도 싫어하지만 교육받을 수 있어 감사해요

translation.en: Even though I hate it.
Olivia Jade had said that she wanted to drop out of high school,
translation.ko: 올리비아는 고등학교를 자퇴하고 싶다는 말도 했죠

translation.en: in fact, when she was a senior.
I told my mom I wanted to quit school. She was like, "That's not happening."
She made me stick it out, and then my dad made me go to college.
translation.ko: 그래서 다녔는데 이젠 아빠가 대학에 가래

translation.en: Mostly my parents really wanted me to go, because both of them didn't go to college…
translation.ko: 부모님이 대학을 안 다녀서 저는 꼭 가길 원하는데…

translation.en: -They did all right. -[Olivia] They did fine.
translation.ko: - 그래도 잘 사시잖아요 - 아무 문제 없죠

translation.en: -They did fine. -[Olivia] Yeah.
-[man] They are-- -Hypocrites.
[Fry] It never seemed like she was very interested
in what college could give her.
Why should she be? She was very successful in what she was doing.
translation.ko: 왜 안 그렇겠어요? 자기 일에 큰 성공을 거뒀는데

translation.en: Things were going great for her.
[Fry] In November of 2017,
Donna Heinel presented Olivia Jade's athletic profile to the USC subcommittee,
translation.ko: 도나가 남가주대 소위원회에 올리비아의 프로필을 보여줬죠

translation.en: and they approved her admission to the university conditionally.
Less than two weeks later,
Rick Singer wrote an email confirming to Olivia's parents
translation.ko: 릭 싱어가 올리비아 부모님께 이메일을 보냈어요

translation.en: that she was going to be accepted at USC
and told them to keep it hush-hush until March.
The guidance counselor at Olivia Jade's high school became suspicious
translation.ko: 올리비아 학교의 지도 교사가 의심하기 시작했어요

translation.en: because he didn't believe either of the sisters participated in crew.
translation.ko: 올리비아도 그 언니도 조정을 한 적이 없거든요

translation.en: According to the government, Olivia Jade and her parents
translation.ko: 정부에 따르면 올리비아가 부모님과 상의한 적이 있죠

translation.en: discussed how to avoid the possibility
of the high school counselor disrupting their admissions scheme.
translation.ko: 대학 입학을 방해하지 못하게 할 방법에 관해서요

translation.en: Olivia Jade asked whether she should list USC as her top choice school
translation.ko: 올리비아가 가장 가고 싶은 학교에 남가주대를 기재하냐고 묻자

translation.en: and Lori replied, "Yes, but it might be a flag for the weasel to meddle."
translation.ko: 로리가 말해요, '응, 근데 그러면 족제비가 간섭할 위험이 있어'

translation.en: Presumably referring to the counselor.
And Mossimo added to that, "Fuck him," and said that he was a "nosy bastard."
Things began to unravel when Olivia Jade's counselor
translation.ko: 올리비아의 지도 교사가 남가주대 입학처와 전화하면서

translation.en: had a phone call with a USC admissions official.
[man] Conducted routine counselor call with USC
translation.ko: "올리비아 제이드 지도 교사의 내부 보고" 그해 지원자를 확인하기 위해 남가주대와 정기적으로 통화했어요

translation.en: to check up on the dozens of applicants that year.
translation.ko: 그해 지원자를 확인하기 위해 남가주대와 정기적으로 통화했어요

translation.en: When we got to Olivia,
USC said she was flagged as a recruit for the crew team.
I told them I had no knowledge of Olivia's involvement in crew.
translation.ko: 그래서 올리비아가 조정을 한 줄은 몰랐다고 했죠

translation.en: Based on what I knew of her video blogging schedule,
I highly doubted she was involved in the sport.
[Fry] Somehow Mossimo found out what the counselor had said to USC,
translation.ko: 지도 교사가 남가주대와 통화한 걸 어떻게 알았는지

translation.en: and went to the school to confront him.
[man] I received a call from the front desk
that Mr. Giannulli was downstairs and wanted to talk to me.
When we sat down in my office,
he aggressively asked what I was telling USC about his daughters
and why I was trying to ruin or get in the way of their opportunities.
translation.ko: 두 딸의 기회를 왜 망치고 방해하려 드느냐더군요

translation.en: His tone made me visibly nervous.
[Fry] Word of the confrontation got back to Donna Heinel at USC,
translation.ko: 그 얘길 들은 남가주대의 도나 하이널은

translation.en: and she left a voicemail for Rick Singer cautioning about the situation.
translation.ko: 릭 싱어에게 상황에 대해 경고하는 음성메일을 남겼습니다

translation.en: [Heinel] Yeah, hey, Rick, look, I just wanna make sure that,
translation.ko: 네, 저기, 릭, 저기요 분명히 말하는데

translation.en: you know, I don't want the… the parents getting angry
or creating any type of disturbance at the school, okay?
translation.ko: 학교에서 소란을 피우는 일은 없게 해줘요, 알겠어요?

translation.en: I just wanna make sure that those students,
if questioned at the school, that they respond appropriately,
that they're walk-on candidates for their respective sports,
translation.ko: 스카우트 없이 진학하는 경우라고 대답하는 거죠

translation.en: that they're looking forward to trying out for the team
and making the team when they get here.
That's what I just… wanna make sure of.
I don't want anybody walking into their high school
and, you know, yelling at counselors. That'll shut everything down.
translation.ko: 지도 교사한테 소리쳐선 안 돼요 그럼 모든 게 끝이니까

translation.en: [Golden] The scandal did surprise me
because it reflected a kind of blatant illegality.
translation.ko: 그런 불법 행위를 노골적으로 했다는 사실에요

translation.en: Bribing college coaches to pretend that their children were athletes
translation.ko: 대학 코치가 뇌물을 받고 운동선수가 아닌 아이들을

translation.en: when in fact they weren't.
Why would a college coach jeopardize their job and their reputation
translation.ko: 대학 코치가 일자리와 명성을 위험에 빠트릴

translation.en: to let somebody in for a bribe?
[Vandemoer] Fundraising was certainly a big part of my job.
translation.ko: 저의 주된 업무 중 하나가 기금 모금이에요

translation.en: Funding going to the football and basketball programs
are pretty extreme compared to what a smaller sport like sailing gets.
translation.ko: 요트에 대한 재정 지원은 새 발의 피에 불과하거든요

translation.en: The school isn't making money by having a sailing program.
translation.ko: 요트 프로그램으로 학교가 얻는 재정적인 이익은 없어요

translation.en: It's great they offer it for students, but that program is in the red.
translation.ko: 학생을 위한 것이기 때문에 중단될 위험이 있죠

translation.en: That money has to be either made up for in donations
or the school is just writing a check for salaries, equipment, travel.
translation.ko: 학교가 급료나 장비, 여행비를 부담해야 하니까요

translation.en: [Vandemoer] My dream would be if my job was just to coach.
All told, I was horrible at fundraising. It's not something I really like to do.
translation.ko: 기금 모금엔 재주도 없고 정말 하고 싶지 않았거든요

translation.en: But it was done out of necessity.
It was always a struggle to kind of survive.
In December 2018, all the head coaches are gonna meet with the senior staff.
translation.ko: 2018년 12월에 수석 코치와 선임 스태프의 미팅이 있었어요

translation.en: It's a big deal, that meeting.
In 11 years, I'd met the senior athletic director a handful of times.
translation.ko: 11년간 제가 체육부장을 만난 게 몇 번 안 되거든요

I mean, this comes out… I, uh…

-[Singer] Essentially-- -For all the good deeds that you do.

So why did Isabelle do the test in Houston?
We gotta get into that story.

Accommodations.

"I've no idea who you are,

translation.en: And it would have been tough at trial. Tapes are…
When I was a prosecutor, I did a lot of wiretaps.
translation.ko: 저도 검사 시절에 도청을 많이 했어요

translation.en: And I played a lot of wiretap calls or tapes.
And juries love hearing wiretap calls.
translation.ko: 배심원들이 도청 전화 듣는 걸 좋아하거든요

translation.en: They can be good evidence. I explained that to him.
translation.ko: 좋은 증거가 될 수 있죠 그걸 설명해 줬어요

translation.en: I heard the call. I thought this was a good one,
translation.ko: 전화 내용을 듣고 좋은 증거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: and it could be tough to explain.
[Singer] So I wanted to let you know, our foundation is… is being audited.
translation.ko: 알려드리고 싶어서… 재단이… 재단이 감사를 받아요

translation.en: Yeah.
-[Singer] Which is very normal, right? -Yeah.
[Singer] They've been auditing my foundation. Okay.
-[Singer] Which is pretty typical. -Uh-huh.
-[Singer] My foundation is being audited. -Uh-huh.
Like everybody on the planet, huh? [chuckles] [man] Sure.
So they've been looking at…
[Fisher] This wasn't a typical sting operation.
If you look back at the larger, white-collar cases,
translation.ko: 규모가 더 큰 화이트칼라 사건을 보세요

translation.en: Enron, for example, the leadership is indicted.
Maybe the CEO, the CFO, uh, the COO, and then, really, the indictments end.
translation.ko: CEO, CFO, COO 기소로 끝날 수도 있는 겁니다

translation.en: Traditionally, a large RICO indictment like this is gonna be organized crime.
translation.ko: 이런 부패조직척결법 사건은 조직범죄 사건과 비슷해요

translation.en: If you're going after a syndicate that deals drugs,
you start with local level dealers, flip one of them,
translation.ko: 지역 판매상부터 시작해서 그중 하나를 뒤엎고

translation.en: get a wire, work your way up to the middle-level dealer,
translation.ko: 도청하고, 중간 판매상으로 초점을 바꾼 다음

translation.en: and you end up with the kingpin.
Here, Rick Singer was selling the product, and yet you had him first.
translation.ko: 여기선 제품 판매자인 릭 싱어를 제일 먼저 잡아들였어요

translation.en: Then you worked your way down the chain to get the buyers of the product.
translation.ko: 그런 다음 제품 구매자로 그 범위를 확대한 겁니다

translation.en: [Singer] They started an audit on my foundation. Yeah.
-[Singer] Which is typical, right? -Okay.
-[Singer] Which is pretty natural. -Yeah.
[Singer] I'm gonna tell the IRS
that your donation to our foundation essentially went--
translation.ko: 아버님이 우리 재단에 기부한 건 본질적으로…

translation.en: Wait, wait, Rick. Let me ask you a question.
Shouldn't we get together over this as opposed to over the phone?
translation.ko: 전화로 얘기하기보다 직접 만나야 하는 거 아녜요?

translation.en: [Singer] Whatever you wanna do. I'm fine.
All I'm gonna tell the IRS is that your donation to our foundation
translation.ko: 국세청엔 아버님이 불우 아동을 돕기 위해

translation.en: went to help underserved kids. That's it.
translation.ko: 우리 재단에 기부했다고 할 거예요 그게 다예요

translation.en: [Sloane] Yeah. Yeah, yeah.
[Paperny] In listening to some of the tapes of Singer,
he's as skilled as I've ever heard
of getting someone to acknowledge wrongdoing.
translation.ko: 잘못을 인정하게 하는데 실력이 보통은 넘죠

translation.en: Yeah, he was pretty good on the phone,
but that's only gonna work with these white-collar professionals.
Historically, white-collar defendants have almost no filter on the phone.
translation.ko: 역사적으로 화이트칼라 피고인은 전화에 대고 다 말하거든요

translation.en: We know people at Goldman Sachs who, you know, recommended you highly.
translation.ko: 골드만 삭스 사람들이 선생님을 적극 추천했어요

translation.en: My husband and I laugh every day about how great your work was.
translation.ko: 선생님 솜씨에 저랑 남편은 매일 감탄하죠

translation.en: We're like, "It was worth every cent."
If he was talking to organized crime members,
translation.ko: 릭이 만약 조직범죄 멤버와 얘길 했다면

translation.en: he would have been made as a cooperator within 30 seconds on the call.
translation.ko: 통화 시작하고 30초 이내에 협력자인 게 들통났을 겁니다

translation.en: So, what I want is to make sure that you and I are both on the same page.
translation.ko: 우리가 같은 편이라는 걸 확실히 하고 싶어요

translation.en: Because I'm going to tell them
that you made a $50K donation to my foundation to help underserved kids.
translation.ko: 5만 달러를 불우 아동을 위해 기부했다고 할 겁니다

translation.en: Not that Mark took the test for your daughter
translation.ko: 마크가 따님 대신 시험 치른 얘긴 안 할 거예요

translation.en: or that she took the test at the West Hollywood test center.
translation.ko: 따님이 웨스트 할리우드 시험 센터에서 시험 친 것도요

translation.en: What do you think, I'm a moron?
No, I… I'm not saying you're a moron. The point is that--
translation.ko: 아뇨, 전… 아버님이 바보라는 게 아닙니다, 요점은…

translation.en: [Huneeus] I got it, Rick. I got it.
I'll say I've been inspired,
how you're helping underprivileged kids get into college. Got it.
translation.ko: 대학 진학을 돕는 걸 보고 감동받아 그랬다고 할게요

translation.en: Hey, Rick. I… You know, I don't…
translation.ko: 이봐요, 릭, 난… 알잖아요, 난 별로…

translation.en: You know, whatever you do, you do, you know?
I really don't feel comfortable talking to you about this
translation.ko: 당신과 이런 얘기 하는 거 난 불편하니까

translation.en: in terms of kind of, you know, your…
In terms of… In terms of kind of your… You know, your dealings.
translation.ko: 뭐랄까… 그러니까… 알잖아요 우리가 한 거래 말이에요

translation.en: [reporter] Stephen Semprevivo, a Los Angeles businessman,
paying $400,000 to get his son into Georgetown as a fake tennis recruit.
translation.ko: 40만 달러를 내고 조지타운에 가짜 테니스 선수로 입학했습니다

translation.en: You know, all I know is that we used you for the charity stuff
translation.ko: 내가 아는 건 이게 다예요 자선 활동과 상담에

translation.en: and we used you for the counseling,
and your dealings are your dealings. And so, you know…
translation.ko: 당신 거래는 당신 거래예요 그러니까, 알겠지만…

translation.en: [Singer] No, I get that. I understand that.
But at the same time, we were all a part--
No, I don't agree with that at all.
You don't agree that we got him in through tennis?
translation.ko: 아드님을 테니스 선수로 만든 게 우리란 사실에요?

translation.en: [Semprevivo] I don't. I don't. I…
translation.ko: 동의 못 해요, 못 합니다, 난…

translation.en: You know, you did what you did, and that was your stuff, okay?
translation.ko: 당신이 한 일은 당신이 한 거고 그건 당신 일이죠, 알겠어요?

translation.en: -Okay. -You did what you did.
I won't take accountability for it. You need to be accountable for--
translation.ko: 난 거기에 책임이 없다고요 당신이 책임져야 할…

translation.en: [Singer] Absolutely. I'm absolutely accountable,
that I got him in through tennis, and that you guys were aware of it.
translation.ko: 제가 아드님을 선수로 만들었고 두 분도 그걸 알고 있었다는 걸

translation.en: I'm totally aware of it and I accept total responsibility
translation.ko: 제가 잘 알고 있어요 전적으로 제가 책임지죠

translation.en: that I used my relationship and made your son a tennis player.
translation.ko: 저의 연줄을 이용해 아드님을 테니스 선수로 만든 거요

translation.en: We all agreed that that's what we were going to do.
You know, I don't have any details,
translation.ko: 있잖아요 난 그런 자세한 건 모르지만

translation.en: but I think you need to be accountable for what you did.
translation.ko: 당신이 한 일에 대해서는 당신이 책임져야죠

translation.en: So I don't wanna talk about this anymore because, you know…
translation.ko: 그러니 이 얘기는 그만합시다 왜냐면, 알다시피…

translation.en: I think there were two separate things.
translation.ko: 내 생각엔 별개의 두 가지 일이 있었어요

translation.en: And we used you, and we donated.
translation.ko: 우리가 당신을 활용한 것 그리고 기부한 거요

translation.en: We donated as a charity, and it was a good charity.
We were excited we could help.
In terms of how you do favors for people separately,
translation.ko: 당신이 사람들 각자한테 베푸는 방식에 관한 건

translation.en: that's, you know, I…
We appreciate any help you gave us.
But, you know, we used you in terms of the…
translation.ko: 그런데, 있잖아요 우린 당신을 활용한 거예요

translation.en: In terms of your college stuff.
We paid you well for the work you did there separately.
translation.ko: 당신이 한 일에 대해선 따로 후하게 지급했다고요

translation.en: So… And we appreciate it.
So I think that…
If you're trying to turn something around in terms of what you did and how you did it,
translation.ko: 당신이 한 일에 대해 뭔가 바꾸려고 하는 거라면

translation.en: then I don't wanna be… I don't wanna be a part of that.
You know, I'm so paranoid about this fucking thing you were talking about,
translation.ko: 있잖아요, 당신이 말한 그 망할 일이 너무 걱정돼요

translation.en: I don't like talking about it on the phone.
translation.ko: 그런 얘긴 전화로 하면 안 돼요

translation.en: I mean, I'm thinking, you know, are they…
I can't imagine they'd go to the trouble of tapping my phone,
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 내 전화를 도청하지는 않아도

translation.en: but would they tap someone like your phones?
[reporter] Real estate tycoon Bruce Isackson and his wife Davina
translation.ko: 부동산 재벌인 브루스 아이잭슨과 그의 아내 다비나는

translation.en: paying $600,000 to help their two daughters get into UCLA and USC
translation.ko: 시험 및 운동선수 모집 사기로 두 딸을 UCLA와 남가주대에

translation.en: through the test cheating scheme and the athletic recruitment scheme.
Worst case, we'd get a call from them and they'd say to you,
translation.ko: 최악의 경우 그쪽에서 전화해 이러는 거예요

translation.en: "Prove you gave this money…"
-They'd ask for some. -But you did.
translation.ko: - 내게 요구할 거예요 - 돈을 준 게 맞잖아요

translation.en: [breathing heavily] Yeah. But… I'm just thinking that…
Oh, my God. [sputtering] Because you're thinking…
If they get into the meat and potatoes, is this gonna be a front-page story?
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 핵심을 알게 되면 신문 1면에 실리는 거 아녜요?

translation.en: Well, the person who'd be on the front page--
[Isackson] Yeah, but will I… But… But if…
translation.ko: 네, 하지만 난… 하지만… 하지만 만약…

translation.en: If they got into the meat and potatoes, which a guy would love to have is…
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 핵심을 알게 되면 누구라도 기꺼이…

translation.en: Look how hard it is for these kids to get into college and…
translation.ko: 애들이 대학에 들어가기 얼마나 어려운지 보세요

translation.en: Look what's going on behind the scenes.
translation.ko: 뒤에서 무슨 일이 벌어지고 있는지 보라고요

translation.en: And then… you know, the embarrassment to everyone in the communities.
My God. It'd just be, uh…
God, just…
Oh…
[Vandemoer] Fast forward a couple months, we go through the Christmas season,
translation.ko: "2019년 2월" 몇 달 전 크리스마스 시즌을 보내고 있는데

translation.en: we get a knock on the door at 7:00, 7:30 in the morning
and it's two women.
They kinda hold up badges and say,
"I'm from the IRS," and "I'm from the FBI."
I said, "What's this about? What can I help you with?"
"Oh, we just have a few questions in terms of college admissions and so on."
translation.ko: 대학 입학과 관련해 몇 가지 질문이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "Whatever I can do to help."
The FBI agent started asking questions about Rick Singer.
translation.ko: FBI 요원이 릭 싱어에 관해 묻기 시작했어요

translation.en: I described our relationship, that he brought me recruits,
translation.ko: 그래서 우리 관계를 말해줬죠 릭이 학생들을 데려왔고

translation.en: he was donating, and they said,
"No, that's not what it was. It was you taking bribes."
translation.ko: 그러자 그게 아니라 제가 뇌물을 받은 거라는 겁니다

translation.en: They kinda wrapped up with saying that,
"Stanford knows about this. They're really angry with you."
translation.ko: 이걸 다 알고 있고 무척 화난 상태라고 하더군요

translation.en: They gave me their cards and they said goodbye.
I promptly went upstairs, sat down on my bed and cried.
translation.ko: 저는 곧바로 위층으로 가서 침대에 앉아 울었습니다

translation.en: I didn't know what happened.
John Vandemoer reached out to me. He was in need of an attorney.
translation.ko: 존 밴디모어가 제게 연락했어요 변호사가 필요하다면서요

translation.en: There was such a sense of urgency.
"You have to meet him before next week.
We have to know if he's gonna take a plea deal or not within 48 hours."
translation.ko: '그 사람이 형량 협상을 할 건지 48시간 내로 알아내야 한다고요'

translation.en: He flew in the red-eye.
I'd never met him before, but he just looked… He was tired,
and obviously extremely upset at what was about to happen.
translation.ko: 곧 벌어질 일과 관련해 극도로 화난 상태였고요

translation.en: And he says, "So it's not good. You're being charged with mail fraud,
translation.ko: 그분 말이 상황이 좋지 않다더군요 우편 사기, 세금 사기

translation.en: tax fraud and wire fraud."
"Each of those counts carry a 20-year sentence in prison."
The allegation is that he joined Rick Singer's conspiracy,
translation.ko: 그들은 존이 릭 싱어의 음모에 가담했다고 봤죠

translation.en: the object of which was to help these students, who were not sailors,
translation.ko: 요트 선수가 아닌 학생들을 요트 선수로 가장해

translation.en: get recruited for his team so they would gain access or admission to Stanford.
In exchange for that,
translation.ko: 그 대가로 릭이 존한테 돈을 송금하거나 수표를 보내거나

translation.en: Rick would wire him money or mail a check, or hand him a check.
translation.ko: 그 대가로 릭이 존한테 돈을 송금하거나 수표를 보내거나 직접 주고는 했으니 금융 사기와 우편 사기란 거였죠

translation.en: That triggers the wire fraud and the mail fraud.
translation.ko: 직접 주고는 했으니 금융 사기와 우편 사기란 거였죠

translation.en: [Vandemoer] They already had Stanford willing to testify against me.
translation.ko: 검찰 측 증인으로 스탠퍼드가 이미 결정돼 있었어요

translation.en: Rick Singer was gonna testify against me.
I didn't really have any evidence on my side.
Between my wife and my dad and I,
we kinda decided that it made sense for me to plead guilty,
translation.ko: 유죄를 인정하는 게 이치에 맞다고 결정했어요

translation.en: um, and be a felon for the rest of my life.
[Fisher] When you plead guilty, you must meet with the Department of Probation.
translation.ko: 유죄를 인정하면 보호 관찰 부서를 만나야 하죠

translation.en: He was being interviewed.
[Vandemoer] At the time when I was in that interview, that's when the story broke.
We're here today to announce charges in the largest college admissions scam
translation.ko: 법무부가 기소한 사상 최대의 입시 비리 사건을

translation.en: ever prosecuted by the Department of Justice.
We've charged 50 people nationwide.
[Witz] I was in Las Vegas covering some conference basketball tournament
translation.ko: 그때 라스베이거스에서 농구 대회를 취재하고 있었는데

translation.en: when I got a phone call early in the morning from an editor saying,
"What are you doing? Whatever it is, drop it and get to Los Angeles."
translation.ko: '뭐 해? 뭘 하든 중단하고 로스앤젤레스로 와'

translation.en: Breaking headline of that massive college cheating scandal late today.
translation.ko: 오늘 저녁 속보는 엄청난 입시 비리 스캔들입니다

translation.en: Dozens of actors, coaches and CEOs are among those charged.
translation.ko: 배우, 코치, CEO 등 수십 명이 기소됐습니다

translation.en: [Fisher] And my phone started blowing up.
[Vandemoer] My lawyer was looking at his phone the whole time,
translation.ko: 제 변호사가 전화기에서 눈을 떼지 못하더니

translation.en: and it was like, you know, "This is huge."
Thirty-three parents have been charged, including Lori Loughlin…
[reporter] Authorities arrest Felicity Huffman at her Hollywood Hills home.
translation.ko: 당국이 할리우드 힐스 자택에서 펄리시티 허프먼을 체포합니다

translation.en: They had guns drawn and everything.
translation.ko: 총도 뽑고 할 수 있는 건 다 했죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] Raids on the homes of the rich.
[officer] FBI!
Every single one of these parents should be in jail.
translation.ko: 이 부모들 모두 감방에 집어넣어야 해요

translation.en: How the schools fell for these photoshops…
translation.ko: 학교가 어떻게 이런 사진에 속아 넘어가죠?

translation.en: Use your heads, people. That's not…
Olivia Giannulli was famous for her presence on social media.
Now she's become target number one for public outrage.
translation.ko: 이제 대중의 분노의 첫 번째 타깃이 됐습니다

translation.en: [reporter 3] Her famous parents are charged with spending
translation.ko: 유명 인사인 부모가 딸들을 남가주대에 보내려고

translation.en: half a million dollars in bribes to get their daughters into USC.
translation.ko: 50만 달러의 뇌물을 쓴 혐의를 받고 있기 때문이죠

translation.en: I started watching Olivia three years ago.
I've been watching pretty much every single one of her videos.
translation.ko: 여기 있는 비디오는 거의 다 본 셈이죠

translation.en: She goes and cheats to get into school?
And takes a spot from possibly one of her own fans?
translation.ko: 자기 팬일지도 모르는 사람의 자리를 차지했다고요?

translation.en: She lost a lot of her sponsorships.
They discontinued a makeup palette that she did with Sephora.
translation.ko: 세포라와 함께 만든 메이크업 팔레트도 중단됐죠

translation.en: [cameraman] Hey, Olivia. How are you?
How are you after the college scandal? Have you been speaking to your mom?
translation.ko: 지금 심정이 어떠세요? 어머니랑 얘기는 해요?

translation.en: [Fry] In a weird way, she has almost become a bigger celebrity because of this.
translation.ko: 묘하게도 이 일 때문에 올리비아는 더 유명해졌죠

translation.en: [cameraman] Olivia, it's good to see you back out and about. Feeling confident?
translation.ko: 올리비아, 외출한 거 보니 좋네요 자신감이 생긴 건가요?

translation.en: People attacked her on Instagram and her comments were flooded with stuff.
translation.ko: 인스타그램에서 사람들이 공격했고 댓글이 쇄도했죠 "금수저와 범죄자 부모" "감방에나 가"

translation.en: [girl] She can look at people's comments on the Internet
and be, "They're just trolls." No.
translation.ko: 트롤로 여길 수도 있는데 트롤이 아녜요

translation.en: I'm not trolling you, dude. I'm pissed. I'm disappointed in you.
translation.ko: 트롤 짓 하는 거 아니라고 난 화났어, 너한테 실망했고

translation.en: And, um… the only thing I have left to say about this…
translation.ko: 이제 내가 할 말은 이것밖에 없어 "구독 취소"

translation.en: [reporter] John Vandemoer agreed to accept more than $600,000 from Rick Singer,
translation.ko: 존 밴디모어는 입시 스캔들의 배후로 지목된 릭 싱어로부터

translation.en: the alleged mastermind of the college admissions scandal.
A neighbor texted me and said, "Are you reading those articles?"
"Do you see who it is?" And it was, "Oh, my gosh, it's Rick Singer."
I started jumping up and down. I said, "I can't believe it."
translation.ko: 전 펄쩍펄쩍 뛰며 말했어요 '믿을 수가 없어'

translation.en: "I can't believe they caught the guy. I cannot believe it."
The messages I was getting on my phone, the news alerts,
translation.ko: 제 전화기로 받은 메시지와 뉴스 특보를 보면서

translation.en: it really was, I thought,
an overwhelming reaction to a criminal case.
[Vandemoer] Walked outside, which wasn't a good idea.
translation.ko: 밖으로 걸어 나간 건 좋은 생각이 아니었어요

translation.en: There was cameras in my face, questions being blurted out.
translation.ko: 얼굴에 카메라 플래시가 터지고 질문이 쏟아졌죠

translation.en: -[reporter] What made you plead guilty? -[Vandemoer] It was overwhelming.
translation.ko: 왜 유죄를 인정했죠? 정신을 차릴 수가 없었어요

translation.en: It was a mob scene.
[Vandemoer] You're not allowed to have your cell phone in the courthouse.
translation.ko: 법원 안에선 휴대전화를 쓸 수가 없어서

translation.en: I checked my phone, and I have an email from Stanford telling me I'm fired.
translation.ko: 밖에 나와 확인했는데 해고 통지서가 와 있더군요

translation.en: I didn't have a paycheck anymore, or health insurance.
translation.ko: 수입이 끊긴 거죠 의료 보험도 그렇지만 어린이집이 더 걱정이었어요

translation.en: Most importantly, my kids' daycare,
translation.ko: 의료 보험도 그렇지만 어린이집이 더 걱정이었어요

translation.en: the roof over our head, was on the Stanford campus.
The same school that was my victim.
[man] Any message to your former athletes? They looked up to you.
translation.ko: 당신을 존경한 운동선수들한테 한 말씀 해주시죠

translation.en: [Vandemoer] I also made the mistake leaving my social media on, and it's just… hate.
translation.ko: 소셜 미디어를 켜둔 것도 실수였죠 증오로 가득했어요

translation.en: I got a couple death threats on the phone.
Anonymous folks sending messages
that they were upset at what they thought he did.
I was the "worst fat fuck" that they've ever seen in their life.
translation.ko: 저 같은 '최악의 뚱보 자식'은 처음 본다더군요

translation.en: "How did I ever fit in a frickin' sailboat?
How could I do this to Stanford?
translation.ko: '스탠퍼드에 어떻게 그런 짓을 할 수 있지?'

translation.en: I should just fucking die and go away."
The week that it broke, we got a call from a Chinese guy
translation.ko: 사건이 터진 그 주에 한 중국인이 전화해서

translation.en: who wanted to pay $10 million to get into Harvard.
translation.ko: 1,000만 달러를 낼 테니 하버드에 보내 달라더군요

translation.en: [chuckling] I was like, "Man, have you read the news?" Like… This is the worst week to make this call.
translation.ko: 제가 뉴스도 안 봤냐고 했어요 타이밍치곤 기막혔죠

translation.en: When the story broke, I was getting ready to go into a meeting,
translation.ko: 기사가 나왔을 때 전 미팅 준비를 하고 있었어요

translation.en: and I got a call from a friend of mine, and he says,
"Hey, who's the guy you worked for at the getting-into-college company?"
translation.ko: '전에 대입 준비 회사에서 일할 때 사장이 누구였지?'

translation.en: I said, "Rick Singer. Why?"
He says, "You gotta be kidding." I said, "No, why?"
translation.ko: '말도 안 돼' 그래서 왜 그러냐고 물었더니

translation.en: "Turn on the news. Go on Facebook. Go on Instagram. Whatever."
[chuckling] "Just open up your phone and look."
And I couldn't believe it.
There's a videotape of Rick just walking solemnly
with all these reporters, and not looking at anyone,
translation.ko: 아무도 쳐다보지 않고 걸어가는 걸 찍은 영상이 있어요

translation.en: and my… My heart just sank. It just sank.
[Vandemoer] Finally, it was time for me to go in.
It's my time to be sentenced.
Rick was still in there.
We literally have to cross each other right away.
Rick, of course, doesn't look me in the eye or anything else.
translation.ko: 릭은 당연히 제 눈을 쳐다보질 못했습니다

translation.en: It just, uh… I'll never forget that moment when we walked by each other like that.
translation.ko: 서로 지나친 그 순간을 절대 잊지 못할 거예요

translation.en: My heart was pounding.
Um, sitting between my two lawyers and the judge comes up
translation.ko: 두 변호사 틈에 앉아 기다리는데 판사가 들어왔고

translation.en: and "conspiracy racketeering" is what I end up pleading guilty to.
[Fisher] Judge Zobel understood that this was a guy who really cared deeply about his students
translation.ko: 조벨 판사는 존이 학생을 소중하게 여긴다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: and there was no need to send him to jail.
translation.ko: 존을 감옥에 보낼 필요가 없다는 것도요

translation.en: [Zobel] Mr. Vandemoer is probably the least culpable
translation.ko: 밴디모어 씨는 아마도 이 사건의 피고인 중에서

translation.en: of all of the defendants in this group of cases.
Certainly the parents are in a different position.
The other coaches benefitted for themselves.
translation.ko: 다른 코치들은 자신을 위해 이득을 취했지만

translation.en: He did not do that.
[Vandemoer] She gave me six months of home confinement, two years of probation.
And I got a $10,000 fine.
I think, for John, that was truly the right decision.
translation.ko: 존에 관한 한 올바른 판결이었다고 생각합니다

translation.en: And he didn't have to serve time.
He's home with his kids. He's bettering himself.
translation.ko: 집에서 아이들과 함께 지내며 자신을 수양하고 있어요

translation.en: He's going back to school. He has a job.
He seems, when I talk to him, that he's in a much, much better place.
translation.ko: 얘길 해보면 전보다 많이 나아진 걸 알 수 있죠

translation.en: I believe, in Stanford's victim impact letter,
they said they're still in possession of over $700,000 in donations.
translation.ko: 70만 달러가 넘는 기부금을 여전히 가지고 있다고 했어요

translation.en: Neither me or any associates working for me at the firm
translation.ko: 저는 물론 우리 회사에서 일하는 어떤 변호사도

translation.en: could find any case where the victim of a racketeering conspiracy,
at the end of the conspiracy ended up $770,000 richer
than they were at the beginning of the conspiracy.
[Amott] Rick Singer is back in Sacramento.
He drives around town. He's still in his athletic clothes.
translation.ko: 차를 몰고 시내를 돌아다니죠 여전히 운동복 차림으로요

translation.en: He doesn't look any flashier.
He swims twice a day at a local tennis club.
translation.ko: 동네 테니스 클럽에서 하루에 두 번 수영하고

translation.en: And he gets out of the pool in a Speedo,
does yoga, push-ups, and he's on the phone.
Sometimes he has multiple phones.
translation.ko: 전화기가 여러 대일 때도 가끔 있고요

translation.en: My understanding, he's telling people that he's not gonna go to jail
translation.ko: 사람들한테 자기는 감방에 안 간다고 말하는 것 같아요

translation.en: because they know the judge, etcetera.
Again, knowing Rick Singer, you don't know what to believe.
translation.ko: 릭 싱어를 알기에 하는 말인데 아무것도 믿으면 안 돼요

translation.en: You don't know if he believes it or if it's an outright lie.
translation.ko: 정말 그렇게 믿고 있는 건지 거짓말한 건지 알 수가 없죠

translation.en: Um, you know, he's plead guilty to four felonies.
I just have to believe he's going to go to jail.
translation.ko: 감방에 안 간다는 건 말이 안 되죠

translation.en: [man] Is the system broken? Any comment on anything?
translation.ko: 시스템이 망가진 건가요? 할 말 없으세요?

translation.en: [Fry] There's a video in which you see a guy with a mic
translation.ko: 어떤 남자가 마이크를 들고 인터뷰를 하려는데

translation.en: trying to get Rick Singer to answer questions, and he just stonewalls them.
translation.ko: 릭은 끝까지 묵묵부답인 모습을 찍은 영상이 있어요

translation.en: Can any good come out of this, Rick?
[Fry] He seems unperturbed by these people trying to interview him.
translation.ko: 인터뷰하려는 사람들이 뭐라든 전혀 동요하지 않죠

translation.en: It makes you wonder about the levels of his regret.
translation.ko: 그걸 보면 릭 싱어가 과연 반성은 하는지 싶어요

translation.en: He's a bit of a cipher in his attitude about this whole affair.
translation.ko: 이 사건에 대한 태도가 좀 애매하죠

translation.en: You seem comfortable. You're taking your time here.
Did you really work with over 700 families?
Rick, is the system broken?
[reporter 1] Actress Lori Loughlin of Full House was sentenced to two months in prison.
translation.ko: '풀 하우스'의 배우 로리 로클린이 징역 2개월을 선고받았습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Her husband, Mossimo Giannulli, was sentenced to five months.
[reporter 3] Actress Felicity Huffman received 14 days behind bars.
[Kalmus] No good will have come out of these sentences or out of this scandal.
translation.ko: 이번 스캔들도 그렇고 처벌도 그렇고 실익이 없어요

translation.en: The fines they've been given, meaningless.
In terms of hitting them in their pocketbook,
what a difference it could have made if we hit them hard
and put that money to work for underprivileged kids.
That would have been amazing.
Then you can say at least some good came of it.
translation.ko: 그나마 성과가 있었다고 말할 수 있겠죠

translation.en: I try not to blame the families or the parents.
I tend to focus the criticism on the colleges
and universities that created this system.
If they didn't have these loopholes
and these preferences for families of privilege,
then I don't think there would be these kind of temptations.
This scandal is not necessarily a reason for colleges to change their ways.
translation.ko: 이런 스캔들이 있었다고 대학이 방식을 바꾸진 않을 겁니다

translation.en: Because it makes the colleges seem more exclusive and desirable than ever.
translation.ko: 오히려 특별해야만 갈 수 있는 전보다 더한 선망의 대상이 됐죠

translation.en: If all these rich people are willing to go to these incredible lengths
translation.ko: 돈 많은 사람이 자식을 대학에 보내려고

translation.en: and risk jail time just to get their kids into these colleges,
then they must be extremely valuable.
translation.ko: 정말 가치 있는 게 분명할 테니까요

translation.en: What are we doing to these kids by pounding them into the ground
translation.ko: 톱 5, 톱 10, 톱 25 대학에 아이들을 억지로 밀어 넣어서

translation.en: with "top 25, top 10, top 5"?
Because ultimately, where you do go to school
has little or no effect on what will happen to you in the future.
translation.ko: 중요하지 않거나 아예 상관없는 그런 날이 올 텐데 말이에요

translation.en: The United States has over 3,000 colleges. You have infinite choices.
Forget about USC. Go someplace else.
You can get a great education almost any place if you want it.
translation.ko: 본인이 원하면 어디서든 훌륭한 교육을 받을 수 있습니다

translation.en: The parents in this case didn't believe that.
translation.ko: 이번 사건에서 부모들은 그걸 믿지 않았죠

translation.en: Because the bigger school had the prestige,
had the glitter, had the glamour, had the bragging rights.
translation.ko: 그래야 어디 가서든 자랑할 수 있다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Why did these parents choose to cheat this
when their children had so much already?
translation.ko: 자녀들이 이미 많은 걸 갖고 있는데 말입니다

translation.en: Part of it seems to be when you reach a certain level of wealth,
there's a relentless pursuit of the trappings of power.
translation.ko: 권력이란 함정을 끈질기게 추구하게 되는 것 같아요

translation.en: You wanna have the fancy car, the fancy house, whether you need it or not,
translation.ko: 필요에 상관없이 비싼 차, 비싼 집을 원하게 되죠

translation.en: and it just seems to me
that the atmosphere created in high-wealth societies
translation.ko: 제가 보기엔 부유층 내부의 분위기가 이 문제에 일부 책임이 있는 것 같아요

translation.en: is part of the problem.
translation.ko: 이 문제에 일부 책임이 있는 것 같아요

translation.en: In America, we love the wealthy and we hate the wealthy.
They disgust us and they fascinate us.
This story was a perfect opportunity to see how rich people live
translation.ko: 이 사건은 부자들의 생활방식과 노출된 시스템의 현실을

translation.en: and the realities of the system being exposed,
and so there's something incredibly refreshing
to have just a little bit of justice being served in a sea of injustice.
translation.ko: 정의가 실현되는 걸 볼 수 있어 굉장히 신선했어요

translation.en: [Fisher] Rick will be living with this for quite a while.
translation.ko: 릭은 오랫동안 이 일로 시달릴 겁니다

translation.en: If he didn't cooperate, he would have been charged,
maybe convicted already.
And right now he's out, a free man still.
And his cooperation won't be complete until the very last person
translation.ko: 이 음모에서 마지막으로 기소된 사람이 선고받을 때까지

translation.en: charged in this conspiracy is sentenced,
and that is most likely gonna be a while from now.
